com.hiddenswitch.spellsource

Interface Broadcaster

  • All Superinterfaces:
    io.vertx.core.Verticle

    public interface Broadcaster
extends io.vertx.core.Verticle
    A service that broadcasts, in a simple UDP protocol, the server host to connect to.

    The client listens for UDP broadcats from getMulticastAddress(). Then, the client sends a UDP datagram containing getClientCall() to broadcast address getMulticastAddress(). The server responds with getResponsePrefix() + "http://ipaddress:8080", a local area network-accessible address to connect to.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Broadcaster create()
      Creates a new default Broadcaster.
      java.lang.String getClientCall()
      Retrieves the message expected from clients to respond to.
      java.lang.String getMulticastAddress()
      Retrieves the configured address used for UDP multicasting.
      int getMulticastPort()
      Retrieves the standard (otherwise unused) port for broadcasting.
      java.lang.String getResponsePrefix()
      Returns the prefix for the datagram containing the server URL.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.vertx.core.Verticle

        getVertx, init, start, stop
